intro: Senecio praealtus var. borysthenicus, commonly known as the Borysthenic Senecio, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the steppes of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom from late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
